Josh was sitting on his bed thinking of what to do next when he heard a knock on his door again. "Who is it?" He asked.

"It's Bri."

"Alright, come in."

"Why are you still in here mom?" She questioned.

"Umm... this is my room." He replied.

"No it isn't, this is Kim's room. Yours is over there." Bri told him, pointing in the direction of the biggest bedroom in the house. That was where the real mother in the family typically slept. "Geez, what's wrong with you today?"

Since he was now considered Bri's mother, he found it a bit disrespectful for Bri to talk to him like that. However it was his fault that her 'mom' was acting this way, so he held back from lashing out at her. "I'm just not really into it today. I don't think Kim is either."

"I don't think so either, but she did apologize to me."

"Well that's good. Did you need anything?" He said to her.

"Oh yeah, I was wondering when dinner was gonna be ready." She said.

"Honestly, I don't think it will be for awhile. Are you hungry?" Bri nodded. "Well, the best I can tell you is to grab a snack to hold you over. Whatever you want."

"Whatever I want? Awesome!" Bri said dashing out of the room, down the stairs, and into the kitchen.

Not knowing what to do next, Josh decided to leave the room. He wasn't quite sure what to do next, maybe visit his new room or go downstairs. He was interrupted again before he could make a decision. "Hey mom, can I talk to you for a minute?" Courtney asked approaching him.

"Uh... sure, what's the problem?"

"Nothing, I just wanted to apologize for my behavior earlier. I promise I'll clean up my act." She remarked.

"Thats weird. This is unlike Courtney, she must want something." Josh thought.

"And I was wondering if you could reconsider taking me and my friends to the mall?"

"There it is." Josh tried to think of what his mom would do. He thought maybe he go easy on her since he was a new mom after all. "I'll think about it. But you're gonna have to back your word about your behavior." He told her.

"Really? Thanks!" She exclaimed. "You won't have to pay, I have money from my allowance."

Josh realized there was a clear problem with taking his 'daughter' and her friends to the mall. He decided his next move was to address it.

Josh looked around the house and found Kim in her office on her computer . He knocked and opened the door where his mom was working. "Hey there Josh! I discovered that even though I'm now considered a kid in the family, I still have my job. I guess you go to school too." She said.

"Oh nice, but we've got a problem."

"What is it?"

"Well, Courtney came and apologized for her behavior and I told her I'd reconsider taking her and friends to the mall."

"But let me guess, you don't know how to drive." She finished his thought.

"Exactly. Do you think you can drive them for me."

"Well," she thought before getting a smirk on her face mid thought. "I told you I was taking off the weekend, but I have a different solution." Josh waited without giving a verbal response. "We should swap our skills." She suggested. "You'll be able to drive, which could be fun for you. Plus, you'll gain important stuff you need to know for being a mother. Like cooking, since you're going to be the one making the food around here for the weekend."

"Alright, I agree." He said, as there was a flash that consumed Kim's office. Josh found that he now knew how cook a family meal for four, make a perfect left turn with a car, and how to clean every inch of the house.

"Okay, I think it worked. Because I suddenly know how to play those video games of yours." She said.

"Cool, I'm gonna take Courtney now." He said walking out of the office. "Wait." He said turning around.

"What now?"

"I don't have a drivers license. It's not legal for me to drive."

"You can have mine." Kim offered.

"It won't do any good. You're a completely different person." He told her.

"No, I mean I'll swap mine to you so it becomes yours." She explained.

"Oh, good idea. I'll take it." Once again, a flash consumed the office. Josh then after reached into his pocket and pulled out his wallet. He opened it and found a card inside, which had his name and picture. It was his own driver's license! Even more surprising, as legit as it looked, it still read he was 15 years of age. "Good enough for me." He thought, and tucked the wallet back into his pocket. "Alright Courtney, lets go!" He called as he opened up the door to the garage.
1131.title: Courtney and Bri continue to nag 'mom'

choices: When Josh returns, Bri and Kim are hungry
Josh wakes up early the next day
11311.content:
Josh hopped into what was know his mini van and Courtney jumped in the passenger seat beside him. "Okay Courtney, where to first?"

"First we'll go to Kira's, and then we'll get Megan, Christina, and Josie along the way."

Josh was nervous to to start driving, especially because it was still raining. But to his surprise, he did everything with ease as if he was a pro. He did have the driving skills of his mom, who had been driving for about 20 years for what it was worth. All he had to do that was different was drive along the roads to the Marshall's, as opposed to the normal walk along the sidewalk to visit Jenn.

When Josh pulled up to the house, Kira emerged from inside and made a break for the car. The rain had let up a bit since when Josh had his encounter with the elderly lady, but it still was coming down at a moderate rate. Courtney reached back and opened the door so her friend could sneak in as quick as possible. Once the door was completely shut, she dried herself off as best as possible before speaking up. "Hi Mrs. Mitchell, how are you?"

Josh was thrown off guard because he was addressed by his last name and called 'Mrs.' instead of 'Mr.', but shook it off. He suspected it was because he was the mother and not the father in the family. "I'm fine Kira, how are you?" He replied as he applied some pressure on the gas.

"Great. Hey Courts." She greeted her friend.

"Hi Kira, did you bring some money?" She asked before Kira nodded.

Josh realized he had another problem: He had no idea where Courtney's other friends lived. He wanted to avoid embarrassment so he refrained from asking anybody in the car. He unexpectedly found that he actually knew how to get to each of the girls houses remaining on his list of who to pick up. The only explanation he could come up with was with his mom's driving skills came her knowledge of the roads around town.

Josh picked up the rest Courtney's friends driving toward the mall. First he got Megan, then Christina, and finally Josie. Weirdly enough, they all greeted him as 'Mrs. Mitchell'. "I'm never gonna get used to that." He thought. Everything seemed to be going to plan. He dropped all of the girls off, after they all thanked him and he headed back home. However, he hit a bump in the road on the way back. He heard a siren, which sounded like a police car. Like any experienced driver would, he looked in the rear mirror to see that he was being trailed and he realized he was supposed to pull over. He found a safe spot on the side of the road and brought the car to a complete stop. "Crap! This can't be good." Josh thought.

In the middle of his thoughts of what could possibly happen, he wasn't prepared for the policeman to knock on the window. Josh didn't jump or anything though and rolled his window down as a reaction. "Evening officer. Is there a problem?"

"License and registration please." The stern officer said with out giving an answer. He was bald and looked about his mother's age and was holding a flashlight pointed toward Josh's eyes. Josh pulled out the license and handed to the officer thinking it was no use. After about 10 seconds he handed it back. "Alright, you're free you go."

"Nothing's wrong?" A shocked Josh replied.

"No ma'am, I knew you looked a bit young to be driving but you have a verified license. You're doing nothing against the law." He replied, seeming not as tense as before.

"Okay then, have a good night!" Josh told him as he rolled his window back up. He was once again not expecting to be called 'ma'am', but knew there was nothing he could really do.

One thing Josh wondered about was why he acted so calm when he was talking to the policeman. He realized it was possible that he had switched social skills with his mom as well. He was a bit more quiet and reserved than the rest of his family, who were generally outgoing. He remembered his father being like that. Kim told him that he took after him and his sisters took after her. Without his father he was sort of the oddball in the family.

As this point, the rain had almost let up completely as Josh pulled out into the road and headed home.
11311.title: Josh drives Courtney and her friends to the mall

choices: Josh takes Bri and Jenna to their soccer game in the morning
Josh does some housekeeping in the afternoon
113111.content:
When Josh finally made it home, Josh found the actual moms her of the family standing there. "Hey, how did it go?" She inquired.

"Really well, actually. I can drive like a pro!"

She gave him a wide smile. "That's great."

As she walked away, Josh felt his phone vibrate in his pocket. He opened it up to see it was from Jenn:

Hey, I was about to come over but I saw you dive by my house and pick up Kira. Guess you weren't able to hang out?


Josh just told her the truth:

Yeah I had to take Courtney, Kira and their friends to the mall. Sorry.


He got a reply almost instantly:

It's OK, I get it. Being a single teenage mother is TOUGH.


"Well, it's go to know I still have my friends." Josh thought. As he walked into the kitchen, he found the two kids of the house that were still at home in there.

"Hey mom, we're kinda hungry." Bri said.

"Do you think we'll have dinner soon?" Kim asked.

Remembering he know had his mother's cooking skills, he gave them the answer they wanted. "Sure, I'll get on it right now." It was Friday, so it was the day where the kids got to choose what would be made. "So, what do you want?"

"How about lasagna?" Kim suggested, knowing it was a favorite among the kids.

"Yeah mom, your lasagna is the best!" Bri agreed.

"Lasagna it is then." He said to the pleasure of the the others.

While Kim wasn't the best cook ever, she got the job done and could make almost anything. The real cook in the family was her husband, but she had to take on the role of 'everyday cook' after his death. The good thing was the fact that she got better the more and more she made food for the family. Now, Josh was the one taking over that role.

Josh got the appropriate tools needed, and opened his mother's cook book to the page on lasagna. The thing was, it was one of Kim's best dishes and never often had trouble remembering in her head. Josh found that he was making it with ease and closed the book halfway through. He found it fun to try out the new experience, and was growing to appreciate the new power the lady at the bus stop had given him. Within 45 minutes, he had successfully created three plates of lasagna, and some leftovers for Courtney.

"Kids, dinner's ready!" He called.

The first one to enter was Kim, who took a seat where Josh normally did. "Umm... that's where I sit mom." He lowered his voice.

"Not anymore, the mom sits there." She pointed to the head of the table. Josh was happy to oblige, thinking it would be fun to sit in the seat where all of the power was held.

Even with four current members in the family, their table sat six. Both parents normally took the ends, while Courtney and Bri sat on one side, and Josh taking the other next to an empty chair for one extra guest. With the kids it could vary due to who had a friend. Since their dad died however, Kim proposed they removed the chair and let nobody else sit there to honor him. Since then, there was considered to be only one head of the table.

Once Bri entered, everyone was seated and started eating. Not much happened during dinner. Playing his role of the mother, Josh asked Bri how her day of school went and how his 'son' did at work. Everyone had finished within 20 minutes. "Wow mom, that was great!" Bri exclaimed.

"As usual." Kim added, not wanting to lose credit. She then gave Josh a wink.

"Hey mom, do you think Jenna can spend the night? She said she wants to ride with us to the soccer game tomorrow."

"That's fine. But it's getting dark, so you and Kim should walk next door and bring her over." He said, and Bri ran off toward the door.

"Why do I have to go?" Kim complained like a child.

"They're two 8 year olds walking alone in the dark."

"But it's just nex.."

"No buts, I'm your mother an you'll do as I say!" Josh said loudly, but not really in an intimidating way. He almost burst out laughing. He had always wanted to say something like that to a kid, or in this case his mother who was a kid for the time being.

"Ugh... fine." She agreed.

"Come on Kim, we don't want it to get too late!" Bri called from the other room.

"I'll be there in a minute." She then turned to Josh. "That lasagna was really good hun. And you're getting really good at this mothering thing. We should do this swap more often.

"Thanks. But technically it's your lasagna." He corrected.

"I'm serious, we should do this more often. Maybe we can let this last a bit longer, perhaps into the coming week."

"I'm not sure about that, school's ending soon and it's getting a bit hectic. Maybe once summer vacation starts."

"Alright, I'll be back soon." She said before going to find Bri.

Once they left, Josh was alone again. But he heard another buzz come from his phone. This time is was a text from Courtney:

You don't have to pick us up mom, Mrs. Goching is getting us. Do you think I can spend the night at Chris's???


Josh didn't see any reason to say no, plus it would make it easier once morning came around for Bri's game. He tried to think of how his mom would type it:

Sure thing hun, love you!


Courtney shot him one last quick text back:

Luv u 2!


"I guess motherhood isn't so hard after all." Josh thought.
113111.title: When Josh returns, Bri and Kim are hungry

choices: Kim wants to make some more swaps since they're home alone
1131112.content:
The morning went by smoothly for Josh, he got a good night of sleep in his new bedroom. Then he took Bri and Jenna to their game, which they won. They wanted to celebrate back at Jenna's house, so he drove them back while Courtney remained at Christina's. That left just him and his mom for the afternoon. The house looked quite messy to Josh, so he decided he would clean it up. Kim meanwhile tried to do some work in her office, but found it difficult to type on her computer since she had lost her typing speed to Josh in the skill swap. Finding it increasingly difficult to continue with her job, she got an idea and went looking for her 'mother'.

Josh was vacuuming in the TV room when Kim approached him. "Hey mom!

"We're alone, you don't have to call me that." He told her.

"I know, but it's fun! Whatcha doing?"

"Cleaning the house." He replied. "It looked messy and I know you do it a lot so I figured it was my job now."

"Nice. Anyway, do you remember last night when I said we should let this mother-son swap go on a bit longer?"

"I do, and I said it wasn't a great idea." He commented.

"Uh huh. I think I might have a way around it though."

"What did you have in mind?"

"Okay, well you said that school was a bit of a hassle right now. That was why you didn't want to go on past Sunday. But what if we swapped occupations? You could do my job and I could worry about school for you instead." She suggested.

"That sounds like fun, but the only problem is I have no clue how to do your job."

"We could swap schooling as well then."

"What do you mean?" He asked not fully understanding.

"Schooling is your education or training that you receive. If we swap it you would be qualified to do my job and I can match your averages in school." She explained.

"How long would we do this for?"

"I was thinking maybe a week. We could swap back next Sunday as opposed to this coming Sunday."

"Sounds like a good plan, I'll do it." Josh announced which triggered a flash within the house. "I think it worked considering I know that Miss Marquez is Dr. Wright's first patient on Monday."

"Some here..." Kim said. "Wait a minute, how could you not turn in your World War I paper on time?"

"Sorry, I just left it on my desk." He told her.

"Well I'll get it in by Monday."

"Speaking of schoolwork, I believe you have some homework to take care of MISTER!" Josh said.

"Alright, alright, I'll do it now." She said without putting up a fight. Josh was left alone and continued to mind his own business and clean.
1131112.title: Josh does some housekeeping in the afternoon

11311121.content:
Josh had just finished cleaning the next room, when his mom-turned-son returned to him. He turned off the vacuum cleaner and looked over to the intruder. “Have you finished your homework?”, he asked her, enjoying the feeling to be the one who asks this question instead of the one this question was asked to.

“Well…”, began his mother. “Almost. I have been thinking. We’re alone right now, so why don’t we swap some more stuff?”

Josh raised his eyebrow but allowed her to continue talking.

“I just thought that we might take this mother-son swap a bit further. When we have this opportunity, why shouldn’t we take it? Also, I really appreciate that you give me something that I’d basically consider a vacation”, she continued and put up her hands to calm him down when she saw his face. “Don’t worry, I can imagine that you may be uncomfortable swapping physical stuff with your mother. We can just stick to non-physical stuff, or however you want to call it, or only have that physical stuff swapped until we aren’t alone anymore, and someone could see you. Not that they’d notice anything, but you know?”

Josh’s face changed from disapproving to mildly interested while his mother talked. So far, they had only swapped motherhood, driver’s license, skills and just recently jobs and schooling. The two have not had any swaps that change anything about their bodies. He had to admit, he was curious about those swaps, but his mom was also right: He was uncomfortable with those swaps. Even when no one would notice anything, he did not want to be seen like that.

“Okay, but only if we swap back immediately when someone gets here”, Josh said. “What did you have in mind?”

“Since you already are the mom, I thought that you maybe want to swap clothes, so you dress like the part. Maybe you want to swap my breasts or my vagina”, she explained calmly. If she was uncomfortable suggesting this to her son, now mother, then she did her best hiding it. “Or maybe you want to swap friends. It would make it easier for me in school.”

Josh pondered what to do. He certainly was interested in swapping clothes with his mother, simply to find out how it feels. The same went for the body part swaps but he was not sure if he was ready for that. Lastly, the friend swap would really help his mother out the coming week, but Josh did not want to be friends with his mothers’ friends, they were old, and he had no common interests with them.

At last he decided to…
11311121.title: More swapping with mom

choices: Josh gets curious and looks through his new wadrobe.
Kim comes down and wants to swap more.
113111211.content:
„Okay, if it is only as long as we are alone, let’s swap clothes”, Josh finally said.

Kim nodded. “I agree swapping clothes with you”.

The same bright flash that occurred with every other swap appeared and when the two could finally see again, they were dressed in each other’s clothes.

Kim was now dressed in Josh’s red T-shirt, blue jeans and black sneakers, while Josh wore Kim’s yellow v-neck, her knee-length, flowy, white skirt and her see-through nylon tights. He also felt something around his chest.

“Oh, I guess with the wording we also swapped underwear”, confirmed his mother his suspicion. “But it won’t be for long, so let’s keep it this way for now”.

Josh nodded dumb founded. He was not really expecting to also gain his mothers underwear and he did not like the feeling around his chest, but his mother seemed pleased and it was only temporarily. “Good, now that this is finished, go back to your room and do your homework”, commanded Josh and immediately turned the vacuum cleaner back on to end the conversation.

Josh had to admit that cleaning while wearing a skirt was less of an ordeal than he had imagined. It helped him to stay cooler. The tights on the other hands made him feel to slippery on the floor. Josh guessed that his mother sat on his bed the whole time and therefore put off her shoes. He quickly walked over to what was now his room and grabbed a pair of black flats, then finished his work.

He was surprised when he finished cleaning the house, how quickly he did it. He still had time before he even had to consider making dinner. He was still alone with his mother at home. “No reversing the swap while we’re alone, eh?”, he mumbled and sat down exhaustedly on the couch. He looked down at his v-neck which would show off his cleavage. If he had one. Josh adjusted his bra straps and relieved an itch on his chest. “This thing is really annoying… I guess women wouldn’t wear them if they didn’t need them”, he thought and turned the TV on.
113111211.title: Swap clothes

choices: Kim and Josh swap clothes again.  Kim don't notice anything wrong
Something doesn't seem right to Kim
Bri tells Kim about the swap
1131112112.content:
Unexpectantly Bri returned home. Jenna's mother returned Bri home to take her daughter to a dentist appointment. Josh was horrified when he saw the trio at the door. Josh knew he had to swap fast before answering. But when he inspected his mother's room, she was no where to be found. He called out, but she wasn't anywhere to be found. He had no choice but to answer the door.

Josh opened the door. He knew that no one would see anything out of place but there was still the lingering doubt that they would see him and know something was wrong. That didn't happen. Josh opened the door, Bri scampered past him into the house. Jenna's mother explained about the appointment and left quickly. It was all very much routine.

Once they were gone, Josh looked for Kim again, but she couldn't be found. She had obviously left the house without telling him. Josh decided to phone her cell, she always carried it with her, just like everyone else did these days.

"Hello?"

"Where are you," Josh said urgently. "Bri came home!"

"I thought she was at Jenna's?"

"She was but Jenna had to see the dentist. So she's here."

"Did she notice anything wrong?"

"No of course not. But where are you?"

"I went to the Dunkin Donuts to get a coffee and a cruller."

"And you didn't tell me?"

"I don't need your permission to leave the house, do I?"

"It would have been nice."

"Look I didn't expect anyone to be back so soon and I wanted to see it anyone noticed anything wrong with the way I was dressed. I'm sorry, I guess."

"You had better get back here right now. So we can switch back."

"Alright, MOM." she said with a little sarcasm. Then they cut the connection.

Josh was mad at his mother for leaving him the way he was. He was clearly wearing women's clothing. She on the other hand was wearing just a t-shirt and jeans. She could wear such things even if they hadn't swapped. It made him angry. He wanted to get back at his mother and he had a way. If he swapped with Bri then when he swapped 'back' with his mother, she would think that she wore Bri's clothing. She wouldn't notice a difference. He would be back to normal and she would be wearing the clothing of an eight year old. He would tell her after a while, so no harm done. But it would be funny to put something over on mom. Besides she deserved it. She shouldn't have left. But even if she did she should have told him.

Josh found Bri. She was wearing a long tunic that came down to her mid-thigh. It had a mouse carrying a bunch of balloon's design and flared skirt at the bottom. Under the tunic she wore matching striped leggings. What panties that she wore underneath Josh didn't know. But it didn't matter anyway.

"Bri," he said, "wanna play dress-up with Mommy?"

"Sure," the eight year old said delighted that her mother would play with her.

"Well, let's swap clothing. I'll wear what you are wearing and you can wear my clothes."

"You can't fit into my clothes."

"I'll make them fit."

"How?"

"Magic."

"Really?"

"Yes. Everyone will be playing too. They won't say you are wearing my clothes. So don't tell anyone or it won't be any fun anymore."

"OK. so what do I do take off my clothes?"

"No, just say, 'I wish I was wearing Mommy's clothes'" Bri did as she was told and when the flash cleared, Josh was in the little girl tunic and Bri was wearing her mother's top, skirt and pantyhose. Everything was resized to fit. Josh was in the cutsie apparel of his little sister now.

"Wow," she said. "How did you do that?"

"I told you magic."

Josh left the room waiting for Kim to return.

What happens next?
1131112112.title: Bri suddenly comes back home.

choices: No, honey not right now maybe later
Sure what do you want to swap?
11311121121.content:
Josh returned to housework making sure that he was in the living room so he'd know when his mother would get home. After about 10 minutes of wearing his sisters tunic and constantly looking at the door waiting for his mother to return Josh heard the door open. His mother returned with a paper bag and a coffee cup, putting on your best worried face you approached your mum "Kim can we swap back now i almost had a panic attack when they knocked on the door!" your mum still quite nonchalant put her hand on your shoulder still being taller than you saying "it's alright MOM, nobody noticed" you were about to respond but she cut you off by saying "i agree to swap clothes with you" and with a flash of light the change was made. Your mother walked off in the tunic and leggings with the pattern on it like nothing ever happened.

Holding back laughter you simply call out "now if you could finish your homework!" your mum simply waved and walked back to your old room. As you were finishing up your housework Bri walked up to you looking giddy "Kim didn't notice we swapped!" you knelt down so that you were at eye level "she didn't notice me wearing your skirt and you wearing my pants!" Bri continued you poked her nose like your mother used to always do when Bri was excited and said "I told you she wouldn't it's magic!". Bri hugged you "that's so cool my mummy's a witch!". You looked around playing along before putting one of your fingers on your lips and said "but you can't tell anyone it's a secret!" Bri nodded her head.

Bri begun following you around and after a while she whispered "so what kind of magic can you do?" Realizing that revealing yourself to a 8 year old may have been an unwise choice you decide you need to try and curb her curiosity "i can't do much magic, the only magic i can do is swapping things between people like i did with our clothes" Bri was very focused on listening "so if i wanted to become the mommy for a while or if i could go to work instead of school i could?" you simply replied with "Yes" Bri began jumping on the spot, "can we try swapping something mummy?"
11311121121.title: Kim and Josh swap clothes again.  Kim don't...

113111211212.content:
Josh thought about it for a bit. 'What was the worst that could happen?' He thought to himself and he knelt down and looked at Bri saying "Sure sweetie whatever you want we can swap". That made Bri rather giddy.

"I want to be the mummy!" She cheered. Josh just nodded his head and there was a flash of light "Did it work?" She asked, not entirely convinced that it did.

As if on cue, Kim came in to the room and looked at Bri. "Hey mum I've finished my homework"

Bri proudly answered back to her 'daughter'. "Good girl Kim".

Kim snickered a bit "Jeez mum, you don't have to treat me like a kid" this made you crack up.

"It worked!" Bri cheered, she quickly looked at you again. "Can we swap more?" she asked.

Josh seemed to be enjoying this much more than he should and he simply replied. "Whatever you want." Bri was silent for the first time in a while as she was thinking, then she went and got a piece of paper and a pen. Sitting down at the dinner table and begun writing a note. Josh sat down opposite her at the table and waited for her to finish. Once she was done she handed you the note and it read as follows:

THINGS I WANT TO SWAP WITH MUMMY!!!
-Schools (I noticed my homework and schoolbag are still in my room)
-Bodies (I want to look pretty like mummy)
-Cooking skill and work skill (so I can be the mummy better)

Josh sighed a little realizing how excited she was 'to be the mommy' to which you simply said "Okay sweetie." Then a flash of white light appeared once again blinding the both of them for a moment and then it was gone. Josh was still sitting where he was beforehand but he saw his own body looking back at him wearing their mother's clothes.

"Yay, It worked!" Bri exclaimed with much excitement.

"Yes it did." Josh replied, but sat there in shock for a moment when he heard his sister's voice come out of his own mouth.

"I'm going to go be the mummy now!" Bri said excitedly as she walked off to the kitchen to get dinner started.
113111211212.title: Sure what do you want to swap?

114.content:
As he closed the door, Josh couldn't really believe what happened. He was just trying to be kind and help somebody out, much like something his late Grandmother would do. He never would have thought to be rewarded for it, even though it was imaginary. He let out a drawn out sigh as he locked the door so that he could change out of his wet clothes in somewhat privacy. Josh quickly changed his clothes as he heard his sisters walking down the hall way. "I'm glad I can at least lock my door." He chuckled to himself as he threw the damp clothing into the hamper.

After several minutes, Josh sat down at his desk and opened up his biology textbook and started to look over his notes from the past week. As he was starting to get more into the notes, he heard his door knob giggle. "Josh, are you in there?" Jenn's voice called out to him from the other side.

"Sorry." Josh replied back to him as he got up from his desk and made his way over to the door to unlock it to let his friend into his room. Although they were boy and a girl, his Mom usually didn't mind if they were left alone together. Since they were in 1st grade, Josh and Jenn had been living on the same street and inseparable as friends.

"Jeeze man, you weren't masturbating were you?" Jenn teased as she walked into his room and nudged his arm.

"What..." He said flabbergasted as he shook his head in disbelief. "No!"

Jenn couldn't help but laugh as she watched her friend stand there in disbelief. "Relax, I was just messing with you. Wait..." She stood there for a moment as she looked at his clothes. "Did you change your clothes?"

"Yeah, I got trapped in the rain and had to change out of my wet clothes." He replied back to her.

"Wait, I thought you had an umbrella?" She asked as she put her back on his bed and started to get out her notes.

"Well, yeah I did but." Josh answered back, but soon had his thoughts trailed off.

"But what?" Jen wondered as she looked at her friend.

Josh sighed and told her what exactly happened. The rainstorm, the old lady, and the gift that she bestowed to him. "And that's it?"

Jenn stood there with a huge smile on her face. "So you're telling me that a mysterious old lady just gave you this gift?" Josh nodded his head as she asked her question. "I find that hard to believe."

Josh gave out a nervous laugh as he listened to his friend. "Yeah, I guess it is hard to digest. Let's get to work." He said as he motioned to his bed where the materials were laid out. Even though he laughed it off, he couldn't help but wonder if it was true and he could swap out his traits with others. "But what if it was real?"

"You can't be serious." Jenn chuckled as she took her seat opposite of Josh, who was nodding his head. "Well, I guess I would swap ________ with you."

Taken aback, Josh instinctively replied. "I accept." Out of nowhere, a blinding light enveloped the room.
114.title: Jenn stops by to study.

1141.content:
"You can't be serious." Jenn chuckled as she took her seat opposite of Josh, who was nodding his head. "Well, I guess I would swap my height with you."

Taken aback, Josh instinctively replied. "I accept." Out of nowhere, a blinding light enveloped the room and Josh felt his head spin slightly as he opened his eyes and had to look up slightly to see his friend standing almost a half a foot taller than him. "I guess it worked after all."

Jenn couldn't help but smile as she looked down at her friend who now stood there with her old height of 5 foot even. "I guess you can sat that it did." She continued to look around the room, which seemed different from less than a minute ago when she was shorter. "Wow, this is really neat." She stood next to a shelf and reached up to grab one of Josh's comic book figurines. "I mean, I never really was able to stand up and reach that shelf."

"Can you put that back?" Josh replied to her as he went up to her and tried to grab it out of her hands and place it on the shelf himself. Jenn thought about trying to put it above her head and see how he liked to be teased for having a smaller stature, but thought against it. 115141111211.content:
Kira was certainly enjoying what she got from Josh. Just an hour prior, her Mom wouldn't let her walk alone without some sort of supervision, be in bed by 8:30, and plus she was wanting her to join the girl scouts in an attempt to help out the community. But deep inside, Kira felt like her Mom just wanted her to be more like her sister. It was then that she felt a vibration coming from her pocket. Reaching down into her pocket, she was certainly loving these deeper pockets in her boy jeans, Kira then pulled out the phone noticing that it was Jenn. "Hello?" She replied into the smart phone, not knowing what to expect in this new reality.

"Hey bro." Jenn's voice called out from the other line. "Just letting you know that Mom brought home pizza for dinner and we're eating now. Did you still want help with the biology homework?" She asked trying to see if she needed to free up some time that night in order to help her brother out with some questions.

"No, I think I'm good." Kira answered back, not really knowing what she was talking about. She hadn't taken biology yet, but was certainly having trouble with Social Studies. "I'll be home soon, I was just walking a friend home."

"Wow that was nice of you." Jenn complimented. "Yeah, I will see you soon." She heard the line go dead and she put up the phone.

Not looking where she was going, a girl around the same age as her had accidentally ran into her as she was chasing her sister. "Sorry sir." She smiled to Kira.

"Not a problem." Kira replied while returning the smile. "Just watch where you're going." The girl nodded her head and continued her chase after her sister. Eager to get home and check out the changes that happened, Kira doubled the pace in order to see them ofr herself.
115141111211.title: Follow Kira

1151411112111.content:
Kira arrived home. Indeed there was pizza waiting for her. She grabbed a slice and gobbled it up. It wasn't until she was half way through that she realized that neither her mom not her sister was saying anything or giving her dirty looks over her eating style. No longer were they saying eat slower or take smaller bites. "This is what I have been talking about," she thought.

Her next 'surprise' was that she now has her own room. It was filled with video games and sports memorabilia as well as other things that had always been hers. She remembered going to sporting events with her dad. She found She was closer to him than she was before the swap.

On her computer she could access sites she wasn't permitted before. She could stay up later. In her drawers, her clothes were still 'girl's' clothing, but it was all unisex. She didn't own a skort, dress, too without sleeves or even leggings.Her wardrobe now consisted most of jeans and tshirts , and to a lesser slacks and button down shirts. She owned a couple pairs of PJs but she didn't wear them if it was warm, preferring only wearing boxers and an undershirt.

After playing a video game, Kids decided to talk to her sister to see if they were still close. She entered Jenn's closed door to find her changing. She had done this before too many times to count. But this time, Jenn crossed her arms over her chest. "Do you know to knock?"

" I'm sorry. It's nothing important. I'm come back later. " Kira was embarrassed.

But her biggest shock came when she went to school. She attended high school now. Her friends were mostly boys. She got along better with them than Josh did with her friends since she has a love of video games in common with them. The shock was when a girl was openly (and physically) flirting with her. This girl didn't flirt as openly with Josh since he was saying Jenn. But Jenn was Kira's sister, this they weren't dating.

The girl, Theresa, was hot for Josh and now she sees her opportunity with an unattached Kira. When she saw her, not only did she give Kids a hug, jamming her boobs into Kira's chest, but she also kissed her On the mouth.

What happens next?
1151411112111.title: Kids at home.

115141111212.content:
Josh's day at school was odd to him to say the least. he was still physically a fifteen year old boy, but he was being treated like an eleven year old girl. This meant that his friends were all girls. He acted cordial to them, but he tried to avoid too much contact. He didn't want to insult them or make them feel bad, this wasn't their fault. The boys treated him like a girl which meant that they ignored him for the most part and teased him when they could get away with it.

It was almost impossible to contact Kira. His phone was still confiscated as part of his punishment. But even more than that, he didn't have time. After school he was in 'daycare' although it wasn't called that. After that when he was home he was watched like a little girl and couldn't get away to make a phone call. At least not a phone call to a 'fifteen year old boy' as Kira was now thought of.

He did join Girl Scouts, but he didn't like it. There wasn't much that was fun to do, it was all arts and crafts and silly merit badges. He wished he could play ball or do what boys would be doing, but not in Girl Scouts.

There was one girl who Josh hung out with a bit. Her name was Clarissa. She wasn't too tall but she was playing in a softball league. She played well but didn't like it. Her father wanted to have a boy, so he had her try out for softball when she was in Kindergarten and he wouldn't let her quit. She had all the skills needed to play but not the desire. She wished he was in Girl Scouts instead.

"I have a way that we could switch activities," Josh told her.

"My Dad won't let me. I tried. I asked him dozens of time. He won't let me join Girl Scout, even if I stay in softball too."

"I guarantee he won't have a problem with it. All you have to do is agree with me to swap and you won't have to play softball again."

"Really?"

"Yeap." This would be a good swap for Josh. It wasn't baseball but there wasn't anything wrong with softball.

The swap was made and Josh was out of Scouts. After school he went to softball practice instead. He was of course the best on his team, in the whole league really, he was still playing with a bunch of pre-teen girls and he was a fifteen year old boy. But some of the girls could play and anything was better than Scouts.

What Josh hadn't realized was how his change would effect his mother. To make this swap possible, his mother had never been in Girl Scouts herself, she played softball when she was younger instead. She loved it and wished one of her children would join a league. Josh joining was a dream come true to her. She also had a new appreciation for baseball and other sports. Josh swapping with Clarissa had changed Kim more than it changed Josh.

Josh didn't know whether to swap back with Clarissa to return his mom to normal, or to continue as he was. Clarissa seemed to be having a great time at Scouts and didn't seem to want to swap back. There was also a changed to her Dad. He would think about it. Maybe he would have to swap with someone else to get into Girl Scouts. But his first priority was to swap back with Kira.

What happens next?
115141111212.title: Josh's day at school

1152.content:
Josh finally made his way through the rain over to the Marshall's. He come up the front steps and rang on their doorbell. He hoped Kira or really somebody other than Jenn would be the one to let him in, as he knew she wouldn't be happy to know Josh was coming over to play video games with his sister. Even if she was starting to come around. He eventually heard someone walking to the door within the house and it turned out to be Jenn. "Hey Josh, what are you doing here, I thought I was supposed to come to your place later. No?" She asked, still having yet to let him in.

Honesty was something Jenn valued in their friendship, so Josh proceeded to tell the truth as always. "Actually I came for Kira. She wanted help on her homework and then we were going to play some video games."

"Oh." She said with a disappointing tone and a frown. But she finally did open the door and gesture for him to enter.

"Is she in her room?" Josh asked after walking in.

"Actually she's in the shower. The two of us were helping my mom bring in groceries and when he finished she ran out to close the trunk and she slipped and fell in the mud." Jenn explained while pointing to her hair as proof, which was still soaked from the rain.

"Well that stinks." He said before the two burst in laughter.

"You can come to my room though until she's out." Jenn said signaling for him to follow.

When they got up there, Josh took a seat on the edge of her bed. "So what should we do?"

"Well I finished making flashcards to study for the upcoming biology test just as you got here. Perhaps you could quiz me until Kira returns."

"Alright." He agreed. Jenn sat at her desk and handed him a thick stack of cards. "You did this all in one sitting?" He asked with astonishment.

"No, I've been working on them for the past week."

That surprised Josh even more since the test wouldn't be until the middle of the next week at the earliest. "Anyway, question 1..." He asked about 6 questions, all of which Jenn got correct. He loved the fact that she was so smart. That's one of the things he found most attractive about her.

"Do you want to try a few?" She asked in the interest of helping her friend as well as herself.

Josh declined, not wanting to embarrass himself because he still had yet to start studying. He kept on with asking Jenn questions about unit the upcoming test was based of off. He noticed that Jenn was getting annoyed with her wet hair. She was trying to keep it behind her shoulders, which presented difficult since she had longer hair. He thought about telling her of his power, because he was dying to tell somebody and he wanted to see if it would really work. He figured she would be willing to trade off her hair since it was wet. As the questions went on, he started to wonder what Kira was doing.

"You okay Josh?" She asked, snapping her fingers in front of his face. "It's been a minute since you last asked a question."

"Yeah I'm fine, sorry." He told her, not having made up his mind.

"Something wrong."

"No, no. I'm all good." He lied blatantly.

"Josh we've been friends for years. I know when you're lying, just tell me what's up."

He figured he would've ended up telling her eventually, so he just decided to get it off his chest. He went through the story from leaving school, to meeting the woman at the bus stop, to his good deed for her, and eventually her giving the 'gift' to him.

"Sounds like a load of bullhonkey." Jenn told him.

"I know it does." The encounter was so weird and I was just dying to tell somebody.

"I don't blame you. The story's actually kind of funny." She said with a smile.

"I keep asking myself though, 'what if the power was real?'.

"You're joking right? Josh it's not scientifically possible to..."

"I know, I know, but just tell me. If you could swap one thing with me right now, what would it be?"

"Josh come on."

"Just tell me." He said in a softer tone, taking her left hand in his right.

"Well, there's so many options. Right now... I would swap hair since it's stiff right now." She answered thinking alike with Josh.

"Done." Josh said and there was a surprising bright flash that filled Jenn's room. Once Josh regained his vision, he looked across from him to see that Jenn now had his shorter hairstyle in the exact same color he had! He remembered there was a mirror so that he could see himself in, if he looked past Jenn. Sure enough, he had a shade of black hair even darker than his brown which reached all the way down to his back.

"It... it worked!" Jenn said in disbelief.

"I told you." He responded, rubbing it in his friend's face. He had a feeling it would work.

He saw Jenn checking her new hair out in the mirror. "Something's off." She said before placing one hand atop her head and then one on his. "Yep, my hair's still wet. Yours isn't."

Josh realized that she was right when he felt the long raven colored locks on his head. He found them to be dry. "How could that be?"

"I guess since my hair was wet from I got groceries, it stayed that way since I was the one who did it."

"I'm not following." He said.

"Wait!" Jenn reached for her wallet within one of her desk drawers. Then she pulled out her school ID. "See, look." She pointed to her head in the picture. To his surprise, she had the same hair cut and color she was sporting at the moment.

"How could that be?" He asked, shocked with the change.

"I think everything's been altered to make this seem normal and like we've always been like this."

"So there was no point in swapping then?"

"Oh no, there was. Trust me. My hair will dry twenty times faster now."

"Well, I guess that's good." He said. "How long should we stay like this?"

"Just until my new hair dries, that should do the trick. I'll want it back then, though. I love my hair, just not when it's wet."

That was another thing Josh liked about Jenn. She had a confident about her look and didn't care about what others thought.

"So should we continue quizzing?" He questioned.

"No actually, I was wondering if we could make one more swap." She told him. "I want to swap _______."
1152.title: Jenn answers the door

choices: Yeah, I think it will be fun.
No, I don't think I'm ready
11521.content:
"No actually, I was wondering if we could make one more swap." She told him. "I want to swap lives with you and see how that would work out." Josh looked over at her with an odd expression. "What I just want to see how that would work. Would everybody see me as you? Would I get your body? Would I get your clothes or what?" She rambled on with her scientific mind going into overdrive trying to get to all the conclusions.

"Um..." Josh looked a little overwhelmed. "I don't know. How about we talk it over and see what else we can swap. Okay?"

Just as Josh was talking, Kira was starting to walk past the door and overheard part of their conversation. "What are you guys playing?" She invited herself into the room and sat down next to them, only to see that they weren't playing anything.

"Kira, Josh was showing me his new ability." Jenn quickly replied not really thinking about much about it. Josh really couldn't blame her too much though. He knew that when she got excited, she tended not to have a filter and everything tended to come out all at once. "Look he has my hair." She leaned over and grabbed a small portion of Josh's new hair and showed her.

"Sis, I think you've been studying a little too much." Kira replied with a sarcastic tone. "You've always kept your hair short."

"No it's true." Jenn quickly replied trying to prove herself. "Here let us show you." She sat there for a minute not knowing if Kira will know about the swap. "Wait a moment." She turned over to Josh and whispered in to his ear. "I think that we might need to involve Kira in a swap too."

"What?" Josh asked with surprise. "Why?"

"We don't know if she will see the swaps if we don't involve her." Jenn pointed out to him. "Look, my hair is all dry now." She replied as she brought her hand up to her head to show him. "How about we go ahead and swap our hair back and we will discuss it."

"Wait, I still have to agree for all the swaps to happen." He was quick to point out. "I don't want to swap with your little sister if I can help it."

Jenn sat there for a minute to think it over. She had an idea to make Josh do what she wanted. She has always known that Josh has had a 'thing' for her. Ever since the 7th grade, she's noticed the way he reacted when he was around her. "How about this." She looked over at Kira. "Josh and I are going to swap back our hair and he's going to swap lives with you."

"Wait, what?" Josh asked looking confused. "Why am I going to do that?"

Jenn leaned back over and got close to his ear. "Because I want to see how a life swap will work and plus it's Friday night and we can have a slumber party." She looked over at Josh and noticed that he was blushing a deep red. She pulled away from him and asked him once more. "Josh will you swap hair with me?"

"Umm..." He cleared his throat. "Yeah, I will do that." The bright flash enveloped the room and Josh found that his hair was once again short.

"Whoa." Kira exclaimed. "That was wicked." She stood there slack jawed for a minute, not really knowing how to comprehend it.

"See." Jenn gestured between her and Josh. "That is what he can do." She looked over at Josh and nudged him.

"What?" Josh sat there in a somewhat defeated manner. He sighed and looked back over at Kira. "Kira do you want to swap lives with me?"

Kira sat there for a moment not knowing what to do. "Actually, _____."
11521.title: Lives

choices: Kira doesn't make it home in time.
Josh and Jenn talk some more.
Jenn asks about making a swap.
115211.content:
Kira sat there for a moment not knowing what to do. "Actually, You know what. I'll do it, and you'll never know, it might be fun." She looked over at Josh who didn't think she was going to go for it. "What, when I see the eyes that you give Jenn, it makes me think that you're wanting something more.

"Okay, Kira." Josh replied, sounding a little annoyed as he threw one of Jenn's pillows in order to quiet her.

"What?" Kira giggled throwing back the pillow. "I was just saying that it would be awesome to have some different sisters for a change and you two can get to know each other a little better." She watched as Jenn seemed to blush a deep shad of crimson. "You know I'm right." She chided her sister.

"Yeah, yeah." Jenn said as she brushed her aside. "Look are we going to do this or not?" She wondered as she looked over at Josh.

"Well, I don't want to do this and be stuck as her for the rest of the year." Josh voiced as he crossed his arms, trying to look intimidating. "I mean, I don't want her ruining my grades that we both tried so hard to work for and I don't want to be stuck going to the 6th grade again."

"Well, we could just make it for the weekend. Please?" Kira pleaded with both of her hands out in front of her. "Besides we will always have the PlayStation to talk, anyways."

"You seem a little too eager for this." Josh replied with a side glance, wondering if she had an ulterior motive for the whole thing. "You're not going to kidnap my family or anything? Right?"

Kira looked a little surprised. "WHAT? No, nothing like that." She chuckled. "I just wanted to see if Courtney talks about me behind my back, is all."

Josh looked over at Jenn, who seemed indifferent. 'Man, she's hard to read.' Josh thought to himself and he drew out a long sigh.

"Well, do you want to swap lives?" Kira asked with a bit more fervor.

"Fine, let's do it." Josh replied back, but they were all blinded by the bright light that soon enveloped the room. When he was able to open his eyes once more he himself sitting where Kira had been and he was wearing her clothes. He was wearing a white long sleeved shirt that felt tight, a white bra underneath, a black pair of sweatpants, and a white pair of panties that matched her bra. He also had pink fuzzy slippers she had on before the swap. Kira was typically a casual dresser, especially when she was at home lounging around, but she was willing to doll herself up every now and then.

Kira now sported Josh's wardrobe which included his blue 'Schoolhouse Rock' shirt, his blue jeans, black and white sneakers, and her hair was cut short in Josh's normal hair style. It looked identical to Jenn's, only lighter in color. Seeing this, he immediately brought his hands behind his head and felt the longer hair that now graced his head. The amazing part about the clothes swap was the clothes were resized to fit their original bodies.

"Wow, I wasn't expecting that." Jenn replied with a gasp as she brought her fingers through Kira's newer hairstyle.

"Honestly I didn't know what to expect." Josh chuckled as he kicked off Kira's fuzzy slippers and noticed that he also had on her light purple nail polish, which was chipped in places.

Their exploration was short lived, of course, with Jenn and Kira's mom popping her head inside. "Josh, your mom called and said that you need to be home in 10 minutes or your going to be grounded."

Both Josh and Kira replied back at the same time. "Okay." But before Josh could say anything else, he waved Kira good bye.

"Well girls, how do you feel about pizza tonight?" Jenn's Mom asked.

"Okay." Josh replied with a smile as he brought a segment of hair behind his ear.
115211.title: Yeah, I think it will be fun.

choices: Josh realizes he would like that
Josh now only has sisterly feelings for Jenn
The next day, Josh has to go to 6th grade
1152112.content:
Jenn's mom left the room. "Wow, she couldn't tell. As far as she is concern, I'm Kira," Josh stated.

"Well you are wearing her clothes and have her hair. What did you expect," Jenn replied.

"But I don't look like her."

"Like that matters."

Josh walked around the room in Kira's slippers in an exaggerated feminine matter. "Look I'm Kira."

"Yes you are."

Then it occurred to Josh. "He had Kira's hair, her clothes, her name...what about???" Josh's hand flew to his crotch. "OH MY GOD, It's gone."

"What is?"

"You know it."

"Of course it is. How else could you be my sister if it wasn't. I had assumed, ever since I saw you hair had changed."

"I didn't even think about it. I don't know what to do. I'm a girl now."

"Yeah so what."

"So I'm a boy."

"Obviously not. How did you expect to be Kira, my sister if you weren't going to be a girl."

"As said I didn't think about that."

"Boy's aren't too bright I guess."

"We have to fix this."

"We can fix it tomorrow. Tonight you will be my sister all night. As I said we'll have a slumber party."

"What happens at a slumber party."

"Well this is a sister's slumber party. So I'll give you a makeover. I'll even teach you how to put makeup on by yourself."

"OH."

"Then when we are all made up we'll try on clothes and have a fashion show...and since your a girl I can get dressed right in front of you."

What happens next?
1152112.title: Josh and Jenn talk some more.

11523.content:
"I want to swap skills."

"Skills? Why would you want to swap that?"

"Mainly for those video games you play. Honestly, when you play with my sister it makes me jealous. Maybe if I'm good at them for once, I can share that with her and we'll bond over it."

After all that time, Josh finally knew why Jenn hated it when him and her sister played video games. "Yeah, I can see how that would get to you. I accept." He said as another flash of light kicked in, suddenly he knew how to put together a perfect study plan for a test, or how to put his new hair into a ponytail. But he couldn't remember the controls to Call of Duty anymore, which was a problem since he was supposed to play it with Kira in a moment or two.

There was a light knock on the door and Jenn told them to come in. Sure enough it was Kira.

"There you are Josh! Are you ready to play CoD now?"

"Hey Kira. I actually cramped my hand trying to hold on to my umbrella in that weather out there." He lied. "Maybe Jenn could take my spot?"

"That's good! No offense, but she's a lot better at it than you are."

Kira invited Josh to watch in her room while she played with Jenn. Kira showed him the 'spot' she had been talking about, and then had some fun with Jenn. The two sisters had a ball, having a good match which Jenn actually won. "Wow sis! That was great, we should play more often." Kira said.

"I agree, it was a lot of fun!" Jenn replied, turning to Josh and giving him a wink.

Josh was starting to feel like a third wheel. "Maybe I should just go." He said.

"You don't have to yet, we'll only play a little longer." Jenn insisted.

"It's fine, I gotta make it home for dinner anyway."

"Wait!" She called to him. "Here sis, just play without me while I walk him out." Jenn told her.

When they got to the bottom of the steps, Jenn broke the silence that lingered during their trip down the stairs. "Josh, is it okay if I make a rain check on coming to your house tonight? I want to spend some more time with my sister."

"Sure, that's fine."

"I'd like to test this out for the weekend with Kira. How about I give your skills back at school on Monday?"

He didn't like the idea of not having the ability to play over the weekend but was willing to make that accommodation for his friend. "Yeah, okay."

"Oh I almost forgot! My hair's dry now. Let's swap back." She said.

"Oh right." He said triggering a swap. Seeing that they were physically back to normal. Josh showed his gratitude for Jenn's promise on swapping back. "Cool, thanks."

"One last thing." She told him. "That was really cool. What you did for me up there, you're a great guy and friend." She gave him a kiss on the cheek.

Josh went from a bit down to feeling great. Any person would if their crush had just kissed them. "Alright, see you around!" He said with some energy, taking his umbrella and heading out the door.
11523.title: Skills

1153.content: There’s no one home, so Josh decides to go to _________.
1153.title: Something else.

11532.content:
When Josh got to Jen's house he found nobody there. At first, Josh was pissed that Jen hadn't waited for him. Then he realized that the rain had abated and what day it was. It was Halloween and obviously since it wasn't raining anymore Jen had taken Kira out trick-or-treating. He finally noticed the scores of trick-or-treaters in search of candy walking around the neighborhood. He decided to go home.

Once home, it didn't take long for the trick-or-treaters to knock on his door. Josh handed candies to the children and commented on their costumes. Josh loved trick or treat but he was getting too old.

Usually the children arrived in groups of three or four. But as luck would have it, one young girl arrived alone. Her mother was waiting at the front off the walkway as she knocked on the door and said the usual reframe " trick or treat". Her mother was too far away to hear the conversation.

The little girl up about 8 was dressed in a Southern Belle costume. It was mostly peach in color, with a white front, hat, fan and gloves.
https://www.chasing-fireflies.com/produc...

" Wow, that is a very pretty costume," Josh said. He just gave the girl a lot of candy.

She smiled at him and said getting into character, " Thank you, kind gentleman."

" I wish I could wear a costume like that."

" Really?"

" Yeah, Halloween is a time of pretend. When you can be anything you want."

" You are right."

"I have an idea. Would you like to swap with me?"

The girl thinking that this is all pretend said, "Sure."

What did they swap?
11532.title: home

choices: The little girl runs after Josh
The little girl starts to cry
115324.content:
In a flash, Josh was standing outside his own doorway. He could see right in front of him inside his own house the little 8 year old girl. She was dressed in the apparel that he had been wearing. Specifically, boys jeans and a t-shirt although they have been resized two little girls body.

Josh in his gloved hands held a parasol in one gloved hand and a Halloween basket and fan in the other. He could see the frame of the wide-brimmed hat out of the corner of his eye and could feel the choker around his neck. When he look down, he saw the frilly peach colored dress that extended from his neck to the floor. He had never seen the tights and the heel shoes he wore but he could feel them on his legs and feet.

His head both filled up and emptied such that he knew everything he needed to know to live the girl's life. He knew the facts of the girls life such as all her family, her friends, where she lived and where she went to school. But he forgot everything he had learned since the third grade. He remembered knowing these things but couldn't use what he learned in any practical matter.

Josh stared at the girl in stunned silence for several seconds.

" Josh say thank you to the nice man and come along. We have all the houses to get to," the girl's mother shouted to him.

Josh dutifully said, " Thank you," and then turn to leave. Josh felt obliged to do as the woman told him.

What happens next?

The girl thinks, "Hey I'm an adult now"
Josh joins group of little girls trick or treating

Josh was so happy that his swapping power worked, that he couldn't help but to smile and skip towards his new 'Mommy'. He continued skipping in front of her towards the next house on the block. He carried his parasol in one hand and his Halloween basket in the other. The skirt of his dress bounded up and down with each hop. He acted like the eight-year-old girl people thought he was despite still having the body a teenage boy.

Back at his house, the girl watched Josh skip away and then close the door to what yshe thought was her house. She went to her room (Josh's former bedroom) laid upon his bed and turned on the TV. She was undecided about what to watch. She turned on Batman, but seem to remember that she liked My Little Pony.

When the doorbell rang and she answered it to see a couple of trick or treaters, she realized something was wrong. " Shouldn't I be trick or treating?" she asked herself. That was the point when she realized what had happened.

Good girl ran to the sidewalk and looked down the street. She couldn't see her former mother or Josh anywhere.

What happens next?
1153241.title: Josh goes trick or treating

choices: The little boy picks on Josh
Josh knocks on the door of his old friend
11532414.content:
Josh enjoyed skipping down the street. He hadn't skipped in years, but now it felt so natural. He knew he was wearing heeled shoes, but the heels were so small that he could skip or run as he liked. He loved the feel when his dress occasionally came into contact with the tights on his legs.

Josh wanted to visit every house, especially the houses of his friends. But his new 'Mommy' selected the houses he could visit. He looked back to realize that his new 'Mommy' was the mother of his little sister Bri friend. Josh now felt that Bri was his friend and classmate instead of his little sister.

11533.title: Somewhere Else

choices: The next day, they accept Josh's form.
The next day, they find something odd.
12.content:
As Josh started to walk home with his umbrella held above his head, he marveled at how the town seemed deserted when the skies opened up. The streets were barren from any cars and all the animals were wise enough to seek shelter, leaving the streets empty and desolate. With his hurry to get home, Josh didn't notice the dark blue van creeping up behind him, like a cat sneaking up their prey. Almost sensing that something was a miss, Josh turned around just in time to see the doors open and several men in white lab coats approaching him. Not really knowing what was going on, he instinctively backed away, but found his way blocked by a wall. The men in lab coats raised their hands as if to calm him down. "It's okay." The taller of the men replied. He looked older than the others, with the grey air starting to show along the side of his head. "We just wanted to talk to you about a job."

"What?" Josh answered back in complete disarray. "A job?"

The shorter man, who looked like he was also the youngest of the trio. "Yeah." He said. "You see, we're from the local university and we're in need of somebody to help test an experiment."

"What?" Josh repeated in disbelief. "You want me to be a guinea pig for an experiment?"

"Well, yes and no." The older man started to explain. "You see, we really need somebody, but you're underage and we will need your parent's permission before we can go through with anything." The professor was always the type to cross the t's and dot the i's when it came to the proper paper work. "If you're willing to do this for us, have your parent or guardian sign these forms." He brought out a manila folder and handed it to Josh.

"What's this experiment and why did you choose me?" Josh asked as he put the folder into his backpack to help protect it from any potential downpour.

"Well, we really can't disclose that information right now." The older man answered. "You see, it's rather top secret and we really don't want to tell you unless you can get one of your parents to sign the form. As why we chose you, well without going too far into the experiment, I would have to say you're the most compatible with the equipment." With that said, the trio of gentlemen got back into their van and drove off, leaving Josh wondering exactly what just happened.

Hurrying home, Josh decided to take a shortcut and go through an empty lot to his home. As he grew closer, Josh noticed that the driveway was empty. "I wonder where Mom is?" He wondered to himself as he went through the door and found it empty. "Hello!?" He called out but was meant with no answer. Shrugging, Josh tossed his backpack onto the dining table and noticed a note from his Mom. Saying that she took Bri and Courtney to visit their Grandmother the next state over. "I guess they won't be back for a couple days." With a mischievous look in his eye, Josh took out the folder and started to look over the paperwork.

After reading it several times, Josh really didn't see the harm in doing it, and with a bit of dishonesty, took out a pen from his backpack and quickly signed the form. "I will stop by there tomorrow and see what this is about." Josh chuckled to himself as he put the paperwork back into his backpack
12.title: An experiment goes awry.

choices: Courtney stops by to see why he was late getting home.
Bri is having trouble with her homework.
His Mom is looking for dirty clothes.
13.content:
As the wind and rain came down, Josh clutched his umbrella close to himself as he walked down the road. As he drew nearer to the corner of Elm Street, he knew that he was close to home when he saw the abandoned lot where they played baseball in the summertime. He stood there for a moment to remember playing there last summer, where he almost broke Mrs. Buchanan's window with a rogue foul ball. He remembered having her a couple times as a substitute teacher and always enjoyed it when she came in. "Well, I better get going." He said to himself, knowing that if he didn't get going, he would more than likely get in trouble because of his wet clothes. As he started to get going again, something caught his eye. Jason turned his head to see a blue book laying on the ground in the middle of a puddle, or at least it looked like it was on the ground.

Jason drew closer to the mysterious book and as he got closer, he noticed that the book was actually glowing and hovering just above the top of the puddle. "What in the world?" He muttered to himself as he reached down and touched the book. All of a sudden, a bright blue light suddenly appeared and he felt a small shock on his outstretched hand.

As the blue light cleared from his vision, Josh started to hear a faint voice seemingly coming from the back of his head. "Mortal." The deep voice said out of nowhere. "I don't have long for this world and I would like to bestow one last gift." From the inside of his head, Josh felt a slight vibration and he started to freak out.

'What's going on?' He thought to himself. 'Do I have a tumor?' As soon as it started, it had stopped.

"No, it's not a tumor." The voice seemingly yelled. "What I have given you is what the old ones call The Power of Empathy. Long ago, the wisest person in the village had the wisdom because of empathy."

"Empathy?" Josh asked, not truly understanding the real meaning of the word.

"Yes Empathy." The deep voice confirmed. "The ability to know what others are going through by having to deal with is themselves. All you have to do is get their permission for it to happen." Josh felt a small pulse go through his head and a dull headache remained.

"Hello?" He said, wondering if the odd voice was still there, but his questions were met with silence. He groaned as he brought his hand up to his head to help alleviate some of the pain. "I need to get home." He picked up the pace to get home before he could get into too much trouble.
13.title: He finds a book.

choices: Courtney agrees to swap back, but at a price.
Courtney doesn't want to swap back yet.
131.content:
Josh continued in his attempt to dry off and getting into some drier clothing before his overprotective mother caught him. He quickly found a red, 'retro' looking 'Flash' T-shirt and slipped it over his head. Just in time too, because just then he heard a light rapping on his door. "Yeah?" He called out to the mysterious visitor behind the doorway. The door creaked open and in walked his younger sister, Courtney, carrying her clothes under her arm so that she can put them away in her room. "Hey there Courtney, what's going on?" He asked as he picked up the drenched shirt and tossed it into the hamper across the room.

"Why are you wet?" She asked him as he eyed both him and the shirt that he recently tossed into the hamper. "What happened to your umbrella?"

"You probably wouldn't believe me if I told you." Josh sighed as he motioned her to his used office chair next to his desk. "Do you need help with something?" Courtney nodded and caused her strawberry blonde hair to fall into her eyes.

"No, I was just putting my clothes away before I get grounded again." She responded as she grabbed the rogue pieces of hair and brought them back behind her ear in an attempt to bring them back under her control. Courtney then placed the clothing on his bed. "I hope you don't mind if I lay them here?"

"Oh, not at all." Josh chuckled as he lay down on his bed next to her clothing.

"So, what happened to you today after you missed the bus?" Courtney wondered as she started to refold her clothes that had come unfolded when she laid them down earlier.

Josh thought about it for a moment and whether or not he should tell his sister everything. He thought back at his Great-uncle Phil, who lives out in the desert surrounded by aluminum foil to 'help keep the aliens from reading his thoughts'. His family never really talked about him or really talked to him at all. He sighed as the tried to make a decision. "I don't know."

"Awe, it's okay." Courtney reassured him as she finished refolding her clothes. "Remember when I caught you coming in late from that concert."

Josh thought back to a couple months ago when he got back from a local band concert, but completely lost track of time and had to sneak back in before his Mom caught him. Courtney, of course, covered for him and kept his Mom from coming into his room while he quietly slipped inside. "Yeah, but I had to do your chores for a week because you threatened to blackmail me."

Courtney chuckled at the thought of her brother having to do her chores too. "But it was worth it. So won't you tell me what happened to you today?" She clasped her hands together in a pleading manner to help win her case.

After a couple minutes of silence, Josh finally caved in. "Fine." He went about to tell her the story about the book and the odd Djinn that seemed to pop out of it. Josh looked over at his sister who didn't really change her stance or anything. "Well?"

"You don't need any tin foil or anything right?" She asked her older brother as her smile grew across her face.

Josh, not really able to hold it in, pushed his sister. "I mean it." Knowing that his sister wasn't going to believe him, he reached over and turned on his Playstation and noticed that Kira was on. Josh noticed a sigh coming out of Courtney's mouth as she saw one of her friend's names on her brother's game system.

"I don't know why she plays with you." She replied, still sour at the fact that since Kira bought the Playstation almost 6 months ago, she has seen less and less of her friend since then. "I wish I had your skills so that I could understand why she likes it so much."

Almost like some of the old cartoons, Josh felt a wave of illumination. "How about we see if that little genie guy did give me something."

"I don't know." Courtney replied as she tried to shy herself away from her brother.

"How about we try it and see if anything happens." Josh suggested. "I will swap my skills with you."

"Alright, I guess." Courtney replied, but felt nothing different. "I told you it wouldn't work."

Josh shrugged his shoulders as he started up one of his favorite games. Much to his surprise, he found himself dieing much more than usual. "What's going on?" He cried out in frustration.

"You have to hide behind the barrels so that they won't see you." Courtney started to point out to her brother. "Then you can pick them off one by one." As this last sentence came out of her mouth, she brought her hands up to her mouth in shock.

"Here." Josh replied as he handed her the remote. "See what you can do." Courtney nodded as she eagerly grabbed the remote. Much to the surprise of them both, where Josh had a hard time, Courtney easily defeated the npcs and began to progress further into the game.

"Well, I think it worked." Courtney giggled.

"Let's swap back." Josh declared as he tried to grab the remote, but Courtney had other ideas.
131.title: Courtney stops by to see why he was late gettin...

1312.content:
Josh didn't know what to do. Less than five minutes ago, he was almost an expert at his favorite game and now he barely knew how to work the controls. He knew that the left joystick would move the character and the buttons on the right would do various things, but if you asked him which button did which, he wouldn't know. "Let's swap back Courtney."

"No." Courtney replied defiantly as she shook her head. "I kind of like having your video gaming skills and now I will be able to see what the big deal is about." She was referring to her friend's seemingly unnatural obsession with it. She looked back over at her brother who was starting to give her the stink eye for her seemingly betrayal. "What?"

Josh sighed as his sister's clear obstain from returning back to normal. "You know clear well what I want. I want my video game skills back."

"How about we wait a little bit before we swap back." Courtney suggested as she started to play again. "I mean, it's not everyday that something like this will happen. So give it a couple days before we swap back, that way we can see what all has been swapped."

Josh didn't really know what to do. On one hand, he could keep his sister's video games skills for a couple days, and on the other hand, he could go to his Mom to demand that she do it. Deciding to go with prior, Josh begrudgingly nodded his head. "Fine, but we swap back after a couple days." Josh demanded as he left his sister playing his games in his room. Instead, he decided to go outside to the basketball hoop and shoot for a little bit. Grabbing his ball from the downstairs closet, Josh went out side and started to dribble the ball. Or at least he tried to dribble the ball. As he did it, he felt a little bit off and his body wasn't doing what he wanted. Hearing the ball roll off, Josh looked down at his hands and wondered what was going on. He grabbed the ball once more and instead of dribbling it, Josh just shot it at the backboard. Again, he felt a little off and watched as the ball fell a few feet short from going into the basket. "Great." Josh yelled to nobody in particular. "I guess I got her sport skills too."

*** Meanwhile upstairs ***


Courtney was having the time of her life with the game she was playing. Her friend, Kira, messaged her.

'Hey Josh what's going on?'

'Hey Kira, this is Courtney. Josh isn't really feeling like himself today.'

'Oh hey Courtney. I was wondering why your brother had the game system and you didn't. I'm glad that you're starting to come around and embrace your skills.'

Courtney chuckled as she read on, deep down glad at what had happened between the two of them. Off in the distance, she heard her brother yelling at something.
