13121.content:
Courtney was starting to have the time of her life. The experience that she got from her brother was certainly life changing and made her start to rethink her life. The beauty pageants that she'd been doing since the age of six, being the social butterfly at her school, and even her thinking of joining the chearleading squad at her school all of which seemed like another life completely. She sighed as she finished the level and watched as the loading screen for the next level. "This is taking way too long." Courtney replied as she watched the loading bar slowly inch its way to the finish line. She looked around her brother's room and noticed some of his clothing laying around on the floor and bed. Grimacing, Courtney picked up one of the discarded shirts and balled it up. Looking over at the corner, she noticed his laundry basket sitting there. Taking aim, she threw the bundled up clothing to its final home and marveled at how it went in without an issue. "Wow, I usually never make it from this far away."

"That's because I think you got my sport skills too." Josh complained nearly scaring his sister off of the bed. "Let's swap back now."

"I don't want to swap back yet." Courtney attempted to pout, but found it much harder to do and instead looked like she was trying to kiss something that wasn't there instead.

"What are you doing?" Josh wondered as he stifled a laugh at the odd look his sister was giving him.

"I was trying to give you the puppy dog look." Courtney answered back as she started to blush. She shook her head and looked back at her brother. "Look, I really want to try this out for a little bit more and you can't get it back until I agree."

Josh's face was starting to have a look of shock on his face as he realized that Courtney was telling the truth. For the time being he was going to be stuck like this until she gets tired and wants to swap back. "Fine, but you owe me big time." Courtney, who seemed extremely happy with what her brother was doing for her, quickly got up and gave him a huge hug. "But I want to be alone for a little bit and try to figure out all that was swapped."

"Okay, I guess I will go and do the same too." Courtney replied as she let go of her older brother and picked up her clothes before she left the room. As she left, Josh promptly closed the door and looked around the room to see if anything seemed or looked out of place. Noticing nothing, Josh decided to reacquaint himself with his Playstation.

*** Meanwhile A Few Doors Down ***


Courtney was eager to see if anything changed when she got back to her room. Looking around she started to frown when she noticed nothing different about her room. Shrugging her shoulders, Courtney decided to play around in her room a little bit before her Mom called her down for dinner. She made her way over to her shared closet and pulled out a pair of her high heels that her Grandmother got her for winning one of her recent pageants. Pulling them out, she eagerly pulled them on and was ready for her next pageant so that she could show up Jessica, a stuck up blonde that tended to win alot of the pageants that they were in together. Stepping into the shoes, Courtney started to walk across the room.

*BAM*

Looking around, Courtney found herself on the floor. Remembering back, she'd hadn't fallen in heels since she was much younger. Pulling herself up, she tried again but this time much slower. As she walked, she noticed that her ankles started to roll slightly with each step that she took. "Looks like I will have to teach myself how to walk in these." Courtney said quietly to herself. Knowing that her next pageant wasn't for another week, she wanted to see if what she learned with Josh's skills would transfer over to him when she gave them back.

Hey can you come over tonight?

I guess, why do you want me to sleep over tonight?

While Courtney was trying to reteach herself all that she should know, Josh was a little too busy trying to get better at his games. "What the heck?" Josh nearly screamed as he threw his remote on his bed in a fit of rage. "That's the tenth time in the last 20 minutes." He looked back at his television and noticed the respawn timer starting to countdown to 0.

"What's wrong Joshie?" Kira's voice called out from Josh's headset. "Listen, how about you go get your little sister to show you how not to be a noob, huh?" Her laughter started to irritate Josh. Normally he was the one dealing out the deaths and having to console Kira by giving her a few pointers.

"What ever Kira." Josh grumbled as he got ready to respawn once more. He waited for a moment and had an idea. "Say Kira." He waited as he heard her grunt. "How about you give me some pointers."

"What no." Kira laughed as she slowly snuck up behind Josh's avatar and succeeded in assassinating him within a few seconds. "Now how about you go back to your beauty pageants and leave this to the real gamers."

Getting tired of the negative feedback from his 'gaming' friend, Josh reluctantly turned off the game and lay down on his bed. 'What did she mean by the beauty pageants?' Josh thought to himself. Josh decided to go talk to Courtney to see if she could help shed a little light on this problem. As Josh got to his bedroom door, he heard the doorbell chiming downstairs and wondered who exactly was at the door.

13121122.content:
Josh didn't really know who was at the door and as he started to go down the stairs to see who it was, he heard the doorbell chime once again. "Hold on, I'm coming." Josh yelled out as he grew closer to the door. As he opened it up, he saw the short figure of Megan, Courtney's friend who still had her Irish brogue.

"Hey Josh." Megan replied as she came in through the door and promptly leaned in to embrace him.

Taken aback, Josh didn't really know what to do. Here was a girl who was 3 years his junior embracing him like a good friend. "Umm... Hey there Megan. What do I owe the pleasure of you coming over?" He really didn't know what was going on or even why she was here.

"Oh." Megan replied as she pulled away from Josh. "Your sister called me over to stay the night. But while you're here, I have a couple questions about fashion." Josh didn't really know what to say.

"I guess, but I don't know what I can do for you." Josh chuckled as he helped Megan with her bag which seemed a little bit too heavy for only a single night. "Wow, this is heavy."

Megan looked over at Josh carrying her bag up the stairs to Courtney's room. "Yeah, I brought over a couple outfits that I wanted you to look at to see if it looked good to you." She was instructed by her friend to keep the real reason for the visit under wraps for the time being.

"Well here you go." Josh grumbled as he opened the door to his sister's room and set the heavy bag down. After a bit of awkward silence, Josh left his sister's room and quietly made his way back to his room. 'That was a bit weird.' He thought to himself as he closed the door behind him.

*** Meanwhile back at Courtney's room ***


Courtney opened the door to her room to see her friend already sitting on her bed waiting for her to return. "Oh hey Megan, I thought I heard you." She leaned in to give her good friend a hug, much like they did at school.

"Yeah, your brother let me in." Megan chuckled as she grabbed her bag and opened it up. "I brought what you wanted by the way." She pulled out her purple makeup bag and showed it to Courtney. "I'm glad that you're finally coming around and putting that boyish stuff behind you. So what do you want to learn first, your brother taught me most of the stuff that I know. Speaking of your brother, why didn't you just ask him to show you this stuff instead of me?" With Megan's family coming from Ireland, they were a little strict with what their daughter wore and didn't want her to look like a whore. So with that they pretty much sheltered Megan and tried to keep her away from such things, but like most teenagers today, she found a way around it.

Courtney had to think about it for a minutes without giving her brother's secret away. "Well, I want to surprise him with it."

"Well, I think it will be good for the both of you." Megan replied as she sat next to her friend and started to show her what to do.

Courtney watched with anticipation as Megan placed the bag near to where she as sitting. Even though she had the experience of putting on the makeup herself, she could help but feel odd with the butterflies in her stomach. It was almost like she'd never done it before in her life. "Okay are you ready?" Megan asked as she started to get the things that she needed out of the bag.

Courtney nodded her head as Megan got out a hair brush and started to get the knots that had accumulated throughout the day. "Ouch." Courtney complained as she tried to get away from her unsuspecting torturer. "That hurts."

"Well if you would just brush your hair like I've shown you at school this would never happen." Megan replied admonishing her friend. "If you don't want to brush your hair, you should have got a pixie cut like Josie." She stopped for a moment before starting to chuckle a bit.

"What?" Courtney wondered as she truned her head to meet her friend's gaze.

"Oh, it's nothing." Megan chuckled a bit more. "It's just that I'm starting to sound like my Mum." She turned Courtney's head back around so that she could finish her hair and after a few grunts and whining, she as able to complete the task. "There that's much better." Courtney turned her head to look at her reflection in the mirror. Her long strawberry blonde hair seemed a lot less disheveled that it appeared when Megan first started to brush and style it. It almost looked much like the way she would style it before she left for school every morning.

"Wow, thanks Megan." Courtney gushed as she ran her fingers through her hair. 'I didn't think laying around playing video games would do so much damage to my hair.' She quietly thought to herself. "You know Megan. I have an idea."

Megan, who was finishing putting up her hair brush, looked over at Courtney wondering what her idea was. "And what would that be?" She asked.

"How about we go get my brother and see if he has any other ideas about what we can do." Courtney suggested, but still tried to act a little nonchalantly about the situation. But her idea seemed to make Megan's eyes grow wider with anticipation.

"That's a great idea, or we can go over to his room so that I can show him the couple of outfits that I brought with me." Megan quickly added as she eagerly started to gather up her things to make their way over to Josh's room.

She thrusted the bag into her brother's hands.

"Look." He sighed as he put it down next to him. "I really don't want to do this right now." He looked back down at his notes, trying to get back to what he was doing but was soon stopped by Courtney putting her bag in his lap. "What in the world?"

"Come on." Courtney pleaded as she bounced her body on his bed, mostly to annoy her brother into doing what she wanted. She then leaned into her brother's ear and whispered. "If you want to swap back later on, I think you should play along." She paused for a moment for effect. "Or we can let Megan in on our little secret."

Josh debated with himself over that to do. Go along and play with his sister and her friend. Or let her sister blab about their little secret. "Okay, fine."

"I want you to show your sister how to put this stuff on." Megan replied as she gave Courtney's bag to him. "You can put it on me and she can watch." Josh looked at the bag and reached out for it with trepidation, but grabbed it anyway. Looking over at his sister, he motioned her over to sit next to him.

But to his surprise, he was blending everything together, much like an artist with his sister as the canvas. After about 15 minutes, he was done. 13121122111213.content:
Megan, looking amused at being able to go first looked over at her friend's brother. "I was wanting to swap lives with you." Seeming kind of embarrassed at the request and felt the need to explain herself. "You can think about it as a vacation."

Josh thought about it for a minute. 'I could use a little vacation from my life.' He looked back over at Megan. "What about school and everything. I doubt that you will be able to keep up with my classes." Josh chuckled at the thought of it. Ever since he'd met Jenn, his grades have certainly took a turn for the better, hence why his Mom never seemed to frown when she came over. But with his grades much higher, Josh didn't want his sister's friend to change that.

"Well you could swap schooling with me and I will be able to do it." Megan suggested, still trying to get a new life.

"How about we do it until Monday and we will swap back before we go to school." Josh counter offered, but Megan still didn't seem like she was interested. "Or when Summer break gets here in a couple weeks we can do it for a longer time."

Megan thought about it for a moment. "I think I can do that."

"Which one?" Josh wondered thinking that he'd be able to get off easy.

"How about both." Megan suggested. "I get to be you until Monday morning and this summer you can be me for a couple weeks."

"I guess that can work." Josh thought out loud, but it seems that phrase was enough his power to activate. He blinked and instantly noticed that he was sitting at the foot of the bed, where Megan was sitting just a few seconds earlier. "What the heck?" He exclaimed as he saw the strand of red hair fall in front of his eyes. Looking down he found that he still had his body, but was now wearing the light blue skirt and blouse that she had been wearing too.

"I can't believe it worked." Megan exclaimed jubilantly as she looked down at her new clothes. She went over to the mirror to see her reflection and gasped.

"What?" Courtney asked as she went over to Megan and laughed. She looked in the mirror and saw her brother's reflection copying every movement that Megan made. "Josh you need to come over here and see this." Josh, not really knowing what was going on made his way over and was speechless at what he saw. Megan's lovely reflection met him with the dumbfounded look on her face.

Megan, seeing the look on her face in the mirror, turned to Josh. "Oh, relax it will only be until Monday morning. In the meantime, I think we should have some fun."

"Wait, it's my turn." Courtney protested. "I mean, you want your skills back, right?"

"I guess." Josh replied. "So what do you want?"

"I think I will take your ________."

131211221112132.content:
"Actually, seeing at what had just happened, I think I will take your height." Courtney declared to her older brother. "I mean, Megan and I are about the same height and that way when you look into a mirror, it won't seem too odd for you to be looking down." Josh didn't really want to shrink down to his sister's height, but knew that she made some sense.

"Wow, that's a great idea." Megan replied with an eager tone as she continued to look into the mirror to see Josh's reflection looking back at her and making all the funny faces that she seemed to make into it.

"I know, right." Courtney chuckled at the sight of her brother's reflection making all the odd faces.

Thinking that there really wasn't any other way out of it, Josh looked back over at his sister. "Fine, but only if I get my skills back."

Eagerly jumping up and down, Courtney nodded her head. "Yes, I will give you both." She stopped jumping at her sudden growth spurt and brought her hand up to her head. "Wow, that was a rush." Courtney looked over at her friend and brother and noticed that they both were about the same height.

"I know." Megan gushed looking over at Josh, who was now only an inch taller than her.

Josh was about to say something else, but was caught off guard by his Mom coming into the room. "Girls, I want you to leave him alone and go back to your room. If you do that, then I will bring something for you two to do." She looked at Josh and Courtney with her hands on her hips and didn't seem to think that anything was different. Didn't bat an eye that her daughter was now 5 and a half feet tall, or that her son was now dressed in a light blue skirt and a blouse.

"Okay, Mom." Courtney chuckled as she grabbed her brother's hand and ushered him out of his own and across the hall to her and Bri's room. As the entered the room, Courtney quickly shut the door and leaned up against it. "OMG, I can't believe that worked." She then looked over at her brother, who was standing in front of her makeup mirror looking at Megan's reflection.

"This is too weird." He replied as he brought a strand of rogue, red hair behind his ear.

1312112211121321.content:
Courtney and Josh went back to her room. "OMG." Courtney squealed as she closed the door behind them. "I can't believe it worked." She still couldn't believe that she was almost a foot taller than she was less than 10 minutes ago. "This is so cool." She marveled at what she was able to do and the shelves that was now within her reach.

"Yeah, laugh it up." Josh chuckled at the sight of his sister using his height in such menial ways. "We're going to swap back on Monday, right?" He watched as his sister stopped what she was doing for a moment, almost as if she was thinking it over. "No, Courtney we're swapping back before school on Monday." He demanded to his sister, but with his new height and life, his sister found it kind of hard to take him seriously.

Courtney started to chuckled at the sight of his brother. From the red, curly hair that went down to his shoulders to the way he was dressed, she really couldn't take him seriously. "I'll think about it." She replied with the biggest grin, but laughed even harder when she saw her brother put his hands on his hips in protest.

"No, you WILL swap back with me on Monday." He demanded once more as he sat down on the bed. Sitting down on the bed gave him time to cool off before he did something too drastic. As he sat down on the bed, he sighed when he found that Megan's reflection showed in his sister's makeup mirror. He shook his head, trying to clear his head, but felt his now longer hair swish in his face. "Grr... This hair is so aggravating."

"Here, let me help you." Courtney chuckled as she sat down next to her changed brother and put her hand on his shoulder. He seemed to be calmed down enough to reason with him. "Trust me." Josh sighed once more as he watched in the mirror to see Megan getting her hair fixed by her friend. After a minute, he found the hair to be more reasonable to manage. "See, I told you to trust me. Look, the reason why I wanted to keep your height a little longer was because of basketball tryouts."

Josh was taken aback at what he heard. "Wait... Basketball?"

"Yeah, I know what you're thinking." Courtney smiled once more, but this time it seemed more sincere. "Oh, Courtney, little miss pageant queen, trying to get on a team." Josh was in awe at the innocent outpouring that his sister was showing towards him. "I just wanted to be more than a beauty queen."

"Courtney, I..." Josh was speechless at what he was hearing. "I didn't know. Why didn't you say something?"

"I was going to, but you looked so funny being mad and everything, that it slipped my mind."

"Well, you know that height alone won't get you on the team, right?" Josh pointed out to her. "I mean sport skill have a big part in it too."

"I didn't think about that." Courtney replied with a look of concern. "Will you do me a favor and swap that with me?" The look on Josh's face was certainly a look of shock. After all, he'd just got back his skills at the price of a new life and a loss of height. Courtney could see the look of concern on his face and decided to point out something. "I just want to have your basketball skills is all."

This seemed to calm Josh a little bit. "You know I haven't really played basketball in almost..." He took a moment to count out the years on his right hand. "In almost five years."

"Yeah, but you played for the school and if I remember right, you played really well." Courtney replied back to her brother and tried to play at his ego a little bit.

"Yeah, but I wasn't that good." Josh thought back. "That's the main reason why I quit, I found that band was more my forte." He laughed at his music joke, but saw that his sister didn't really get it. "Now, if I swap my skills with you what do you have to offer and how long do you want to keep them?" He really didn't want to have something from his sister, but found the negotiations to be a little bit addicting.

"I'm willing to give you anything." Courtney replied after thinking about it for a moment. "But I want to keep it as long as I'm on the team."

"That's only fair." Josh replied thinking about it too. "How about you think about it for a little bit longer and let me know on Monday when we swap back, okay?"

"If I exchange something for your basketball skills, then we will be stuck until we swap back?" Courtney wondered out loud to her brother.

"Yeah, that way I know I will get it back and I think it will need to be something that you will want back." Josh pointed out to his sister. "I mean, I don't want to get your hay fever or your period." He shuddered slightly at the thought of having his sister's period for her.

Courtney chuckled at that. "Agreed. I will think it over and will try to make it worth your while."

14.content:
As Josh was on his way home, the rain intenisfied to the point where he could hardly see more than 20 feet ahead. Many people were running around trying to get to where they needed to be before the rain got worse. Cars were sliding around on the road, it looked like a dangerous time to drive. Josh realized that it might have been better if he didn't take the school bus. He started to run a few times, not wanting to be caught in bad weather. This plan came to no avail however, as he slipped and almost fell flat on his face a couple of times before deciding to take it slow and easy. A truck drove by a giant puddle, and Josh was the victim of the wet and muddy splash. Soaking wet and cold, Josh hurried home with the protection of his umbrella. Luckily for him, Josh found a note on the kitchen table when he walked in. It was from his mom reading that she went to go pick up Bri from elementary school, while Courtney stayed after school for some math tutoring. This bought him some time so his mom wouldn't catch him walking around the house in his current state, nor would his sisters witness to snitch later.

Seeing as he was soaked, cold, and muddy, Josh decided it would be best if he took a shower now. It was Friday, and he wasn't planning on leaving the house anyway. He took a quick ten minute shower, not wanting his mom or sisters to walk in and ask questions he rinsed off, shampooed, and washed his body as quickly as possible. As he went along he thought about several things, such as his first move once he got out of the shower, what he would do over the weekend, remembering to get his paper to Mr. Jackson by Monday, and picturing him and Jenn as more than friends. It wasn't any weirder than his typical shower. He eventually turned the water off, ready to hop out of the shower. He was about to reach out for his towel, but he slippedon the floor! The last thing Josh remembered was his head hitting what he thought was the shower drain after his hard fall. Then he blacked out.

While he was unconscious, Josh had what he guessed was some type of dream. He saw his room around him and thought he awoke in his bed, but he was in a ghost form floating upward. He was eventually was out in the rainy weather again, but couldn't feel the rain whatsoever. He floated up to where he was then above the dark clouds. And all he could see was sunshine with nothing else but the sun and blue skies above his head before his long rise upward ceased.

"Where am I?" Josh asked. "Am I dead?"

"NO YOU ARE NOT!" A loud booming voice suddenly roared, startling the ghostly boy. The voice reminded Josh of his late father's, but much deeper.

"Who are you?" Josh asked nervously.

"THAT IS NOT IMPORTANT! WHAT YOU ARE HEAR FOR IS!"

"Why am I here?"

"I HAVE CHOSEN YOU AT RANDOM TO BE GIVEN A NEW POWER!"

This booming statement seemed to pique Josh's interest. "And, what is this new 'power'?

"THE ULTIMATE POWER OF EMPATHY!"

"The ultimate power of empathy?"

"YES! YOU MAY EXPERIENCE HOW YOUR FELLOW HUMANS LIVE WITH CONSENT!"

"Which means..." Josh trailed off, hoping for a more clear answer.

"YOU MAY SWITCH INDIVIDUAL ATTRIBUTES WITH OTHERS WITH AN AGREEMENT OR THEIR PERMISSION!"

Before, Josh could ask any more questions, he felt himself fall back down. Only now, he was human again dropping at an alarming rate. He was about to collide with the roof of his house. But the dream suddenly ended, and he opened his eyes. He looked over to his clock, with read 8:30 AM. Josh knew he hopped in the shower before 3:30 PM. It must have been Saturday now! "Did really sleep for 18 hours?" Josh thought, rubbing his head, still hurting where he bumped his head on the shower drain. He remembered the strange dream from when he slept, but didn't think anything of it, as he didn't think it actually happened nor did he really understand it. If the voice meant what Josh thought it did, then he definitely must have been dreaming. It was physically impossible to swap traits between two people. It was then he noticed that ______ was sitting there beside his bed, and they were just noticing his awakening.

15.title: Something else

choices: Kim sees her son walking in drenched.
151.content:
The rain continued to fall at a significant rate with no appearance of quitting any time soon. The constant pitter patter of the rain was only interrupted by the couple of cars that drove by. Josh walked on and soon found he was near a bus stop. "Too bad I don't have a bus pass." He said to himself as he took refuge from the rain in the empty, enclosed stop. He furled up his umbrella and sat down in the enclosure. Back a few years back, the city started to put on these plexiglass enclosures up after much of the community complained about the long waits for the public transportation and having to do so with the constantly changing weather. 'At least, I can take a small break.' Josh thought to himself as he heard a squeaking sound. The sound reminded him of the horrible carts at the big-box store Wal-Mart and he couldn't help but roll his eyes.

"Is this seat taken?" A gravely voice asked as Josh turned to see an older woman pushing a well worn walker. Her hair looked like she had just got out of the shower and her clothes were sopping wet too. Josh got up and offered her the seat. He noticed that she seemed to be smelling of cat urine and deciding not to make eye contact with the woman, Josh continued to look straight ahead ignoring the lady almost as if he was entranced by the white noise that the rain caused. "It's really coming down today, isn't it?" The older lady asked him with a seemingly aggravated tone.

He just nodded his head and tried his best not to breathe out of his nose to help avoid the smell the seemed to be emanating from the old lady.

Seemingly a little irritated at the lack of interest her 'shelter partner' seemed to have, she replied. "Yes and I can certainly feel it in my old bones." Josh looked over and noticed that she seemed to be wringing her hands trying to alleviate some of the pain that the years of hard work caused in her gnarled hands.

"Mhmm...." Josh replied as he noticed the rain starting to let up some. Not wanting to assault his senses any longer, Josh left the shelter without saying a word or gesturing over to lady to tell her farewell.

"Aren't you a bit a pretentious asshole." The elderly lady responded back to him as she watched him avoid a puddle of water that began to fill up in a pot hole. She narrowed her eyes as she watched Josh laugh at his freedom. Having enough of his attitude, she brought up her gnarled hands and pointed both of them in his direction. As she replied under her breath, she chuckled slightly at her target as he stopped dead in his tracks looking around for something around him.

"Since you care about how you look around others, you shall be cursed to swap the traits that others wish to give you."

"What?" Josh replied while he looked around the street to find the mysterious voice, but soon found that as mysteriously and quickly that it had started, he noticed that it had ended, just as quick.

Looking up and down the street in hopes to find the owner of the mysterious voice, but only found the occasional stray animal wandering the rain soaked streets. "What the..." He shook his head in disbelief. "Well, I guess I better get back to getting home before Courtney and Bri worry." With the rain coming down even harder than before and his umbrella seemingly disappeared, Josh found he made better time by running. Several minutes later, Josh found his way back to the home and in the bathroom to dry off and put on some dry clothes. Having found some drier clothing, he made his way to his room to see about getting his homework done.
151.title: The curse

info.brief_description: Josh obtains a power to swap traits, but only with their permission.
info.description:
Over 500 chapters and 28,000 views!!
Let's continue the great work.


Josh Mitchell is a normal 15 year old boy. That is, until he gets the life changing ability.

The power can be obtained many different ways (Occult/witchcraft, sci/fi, gypsy)

Special thanks to Blarg Blargington for their idea.
Permission to Swap  

The ones who are swapped are:

The only ones aware of the swap. (The reality is altered around them to make it seem normal.)
Not immune to the effects of any mental swaps. (If Josh were to swap interests with Bri, then he would find playing soccer much more enjoyable than before.)

List of characters

Josh Mitchell (15, Main Character) - 5' 5" tall with brown hair. Slight athletic build and makes mostly B's in his classes. Has few personal friends and is always willing to go the extra mile to help his friends and family.

Kim Mitchell (36, Josh's Mom) - 5' 6" with C-cup chest and shoulder length strawberry blonde hair. Works as a Dental Assistant at Dr. Wright's Dental office to make ends meet since her husband left her and the kids for his secretary. Although caring, she wants what's best for her children, even if it goes against what they want.

Courtney Mitchell (12, Josh's sister) 4' 8" with A-cup chest and shoulder length strawberry blonde hair. She is very energetic and loves to be the center of attention. She's fearless, self-centered, bratty, and spoiled. For a 6th grader, she's stylish and popular at school.

Brianna (Bri) Mitchell (8, Josh's youngest sister) - 4' 2" with Long brown hair usually held in a pony tail. She enjoys playing on her all-girl soccer team and going over to her friend next door, Jenna's house.

Katie Taylor (9, Bri's friend) - 4' with straight, black hair that goes down to her mid back and Almond-shaped eyes. Her Dad is a Sergeant in the US Army and married her Mom in Japan. She wishes to be like her friend Bri and be a tomboy, but her Mom want her to be a proper lady.

Jennifer (Jen) Marshall (15, Josh's friend) - 5' with B-cup chest and straight black hair that descends down her back. Having been friends with Josh since the 5th grade, she only sees him as a friend. A rather studious individual, she can almost always be found with her nose in a book. Is called Jenny by her mom and sister, Kira.

Kira Marshall (11, Courtney's friend and Jen's sister) - 4' 7" with an A cup and has her brown hair always in a pony tail. Being the younger sister of Jen, Kira was almost always a frequent guest over at the Mitchell's house. She is always found playing on her Gameboy or the PlayStation that she was able to get by saving up her allowance. Jen doesn't like that she and Josh are friends on the game system, but is starting to come around.

Megan McCulley (11, Courtney's friend) - 4' 7" with an A cup chest and curly red hair that goes down to her shoulders. Being the first born child from Irish immigrants, Megan seems to love the American way of life. From being a cheerleader to singing in the school choir, Megan seems to love it all.

Christina Goching (11, Courtney's friend) - 4' 5" with barely an AA cup and has straight brown hair that cascades down her back. Usually being quite reserved, Christina is a quiet person that would rather read a book or watch a movie than go out with friends. Not developing as fast as her friends, she feels ashamed and feels as if she is being left behind.

Josie McDaniels (12, Courtney's friend) - 4' 11" with a small B cup and has her blonde hair in a pixie cut. She is a bit of a tomboy and enjoys playing sports. Being on the volleyball, basketball, and softball teams, Josie is seemingly always tries to make everything into a competition.

Leah Thomas (24, Kim's friend from Book club) - 5' 3" with a B cup and her curly black hair goes down to her shoulders. Being the trophy wife of her Major League Baseball husband, Leah has all the time in the world to take care of herself and the house. Although she does get a little lonely at times, Leah always tries to find something to do with her friends.

Ashley Reynolds (26, Kim's friend from the Book club) - 5' 8" with a C cup and light brown hair that goes down to her mid back. Being a single mom of 2 girls (4 and 6 years of age), Ashley is trying to show her children what a strong person is and works her hardest to do her best at her job as a secretary to University President.

Elizabeth 'Beth' Fletching (35, Kim's friend from the Book club) - 5' 0" with an A cup and curly brown hair that went down to below her ears. Being alone for most of her life, Beth had always fallen into the wrong crowds. But recently, she was able to get her life back together and now has her Master's Degree in Music, which allows her to teach at the local high school and has Josh in one of her classes. Ashley and Beth have been friends for the past few years and enjoy going to lunch together.

Catherine 'Cat' Marquez (35, Kim's friend from the Book club) - 5' 4" with a small B cup and has her blonde hair in a pixie cut. Having come out several years ago, Cat has been trying her best to find the right person. Being the softball coach at the local University has helped Cat with her life and sexuality. She has recently been seen with the basketball coach around town.

Mary McCulley (30, Kim's friend from the Book club and Megan's Mom) - 5' 1" with a B cup and her curly red hair that goes past her shoulders. Having Megan at a young age, Mary had never had time to do anything. After coming here from Ireland with her husband, Jason, Mary had found it hard to fit in since she stays at home and only recently started to come to the Book Club meetings to get out of the house.

Nora Daniels (10, a girl that goes to Courtney's school) - 4' 5" with a small A-cup and long dark hair that goes down to her mid back. Rides the bus with Megan to school and has an older brother.

(More to come with the addition of chapters.)

Some rules:

No excessively explicit descriptions of sex or violence. (Try to keep it PG-13 at the most.)
Both parties must agree to the transfer for it to occur, but that doesn't have to be known by the Main character.
The swaps can only be made between two individuals if they are within the same room. If others are within the room, they can see the swaps, if they know of the power. (Josh has already told them about it.)
Please no swapping with fictional characters.
Try to add at least 1,000 characters, if not able to, at least have great grammar.
No ending the story abruptly.
By adding to this story, you allow the author to fix any bad grammar and typos. If there are too many typos and I'm unable to fix the chapter, it may be deleted.

As of 8/1/18 - All 'How about' chapters will automatically be deleted.




Points will be given if the rules are followed.
